file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 52-12-11-04 - MAIN-DOOR ACTUATION-SYSTEM EMERGENCY VALVE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL MAIN-DOOR ACTUATION-SYSTEM EMERGENCY VALVE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH AIRSTAIRS DOOR 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the emergency valve of the main-door actuation system. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY AIRCRAFT WITH AIR- MAIN-DOOR ACTUATION-SYSTEM 52-12-11-000-801-A STAIRS DOOR EMERGENCY VALVE - REMOVAL AIRCRAFT WITH AIR- MAIN-DOOR ACTUATION-SYSTEM 52-12-11-400-801-A STAIRS DOOR EMERGENCY VALVE - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 52-12-11 Page 1 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 52-12-11-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH AIRSTAIRS DOOR 2. MAIN-DOOR ACTUATION-SYSTEM EMERGENCY VALVE - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the emergency valve of the main-door actuation system. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - PRESSURIZATION WITH AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200 EMDP C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 223/224 222GF Cockpit 123/124 123BL Below the Cockpit Floor 114 114CR Nose Hydraulic Compartment D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Rubber Gloves, Phosphate Ester-Base, Protection for the Hands 1 available Fluid-Resistant Commercially Rubber Goggles, Phosphate Ester- Protection for the Eyes 1 available Base, Fluid-Resistant F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit, below the cockpit floor EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 52-12-11 Page 2 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the ELEC PUMP 1 circuit breaker and attach a DO- NOT-CLOSE tag to it. (2) Open access door 222GF in the cockpit floor (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100). (3) Remove access panel 123BL (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (4) Open access door 114CR of the nose hydraulic compartment (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (5) Totally release the pressure from the hydraulic system ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200). (6) Totally release the pressure from the fluid chamber of the hydraulic accumulator of the main-door actuation system. For this, open the discharge valve and monitor the pressure gage until it shows the nitrogen precharge. (7) Release the pressure from the spring accumulator. For this, do the steps below: (a) Open the main-door emergency valve in the cockpit. (b) Manually open and close the main door two or three times. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A WARNING:THE HYDRAULIC SYSTEM CONTAINS PHOSPHATE-ESTER HYDRAULIC FLUID. THE FLUID CAN CAUSE IRRITATION IN YOUR SKIN OR INJURY TO YOUR EYES. USE THE APPLICABLE RUBBER GOGGLES AND GLOVES. IF IT GETS IN YOUR EYES, FLUSH THEM WITH WATER AND GET MEDICAL HELP. (1) Disconnect the hydraulic tubes (1) and (3). (2) Remove the emergency valve (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 52-12-11 Page 3 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 52-12-11-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH AIRSTAIRS DOOR 3. MAIN-DOOR ACTUATION-SYSTEM EMERGENCY VALVE - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the emergency valve of the main-door actuation system. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - PRESSURIZATION WITH AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200 EMDP IPC 52-12-00 MAIN DOOR - LIFTING AND LOWERING SYSTEM C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 223/224 222GF Cockpit 123/124 123BL Below the cockpit floor 114 114CR Nose hydraulic compartment D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Rubber Gloves, Phosphate Ester-Base, Protection for the hands 1 available Fluid-Resistant Commercially Rubber Goggles, Phosphate Ester- Protection for the eyes 1 available Base, Fluid-Resistant F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) O'ring IPC 52-12-00 1 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 52-12-11 Page 6 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit, below the cockpit floor I. Preparation (Figure 402) SUBTASK 841-003-A WARNING:THE HYDRAULIC SYSTEM CONTAINS PHOSPHATE-ESTER HYDRAULIC FLUID. THE FLUID CAN CAUSE IRRITATION IN YOUR SKIN OR INJURY TO YOUR EYES. USE THE APPLICABLE RUBBER GOGGLES AND GLOVES. IF IT GETS IN YOUR EYES, FLUSH THEM WITH WATER AND GET MEDICAL HELP. (1) Remove and keep the hydraulic connection (4). (2) Remove and discard the old O'ring (5). (3) Remove and keep the nut (7) and washer (6). (4) Install the new O'ring (5). (5) Install the hydraulic connection (4). (6) Install the washer (6) and nut (7). J. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Put the emergency valve (2) between the hydraulic tubes (1) and (3) in the cockpit. (2) Connect the hydraulic tubes (1) and (3). K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, close the ELEC PUMP 1 circuit breaker and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from it. (2) Pressurize hydraulic system 1 ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200). (3) Do a check on the hydraulic connections of the emergency valve for leaks. (4) Do an operational check of the main door. (5) Close access door 222GF in the cockpit floor (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100). (6) Install access panel 123BL (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (7) Close access door 114CR of the nose hydraulic compartment (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 52-12-11 Page 7 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
